submission.title: AI-Augmented Data Visibility for Safer Web Experiences
submission.overview: This submission proposes an AI-augmented tool (e.g., a browser extension or embedded prototype) that transparently reveals what data is being collected and tracked during web interactions. It aims to equip users with actionable insight into data flows and help mitigate exploitative ad-based surveillance. This submission was generated with protocol META-DP-EVAL-v1.3.

directly_addressed_dps.summary: Empowers users to understand and control how their data is collected and shared.
Enables visibility into third-party trackers and data collectors, promoting stronger user data control.
Introduces transparent, real-time visualizations of data tracking behavior to rebuild trust in web interactions.
Supports efforts to prevent data misuse by surfacing insecure or opaque data flows.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: Visual Data Awareness Tools
clarifications_and_extensions.clarification: This submission suggests that tools helping users visualize which data is being harvested—especially through ads or embedded trackers—should be considered a core part of data sovereignty.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: When users are unaware of ongoing surveillance, sovereignty is functionally absent. Making data tracking legible is a first step toward reclaiming control.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: Real-Time Adversarial Tracking Indicators
clarifications_and_extensions.extension: Integrating AI-driven detection of manipulative or excessive tracking behavior with real-time alerts and summaries can extend the Meta-layer's trust framework.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: This creates a responsive and educational layer that cultivates informed digital behavior while countering abusive practices.
